message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG

The paper focuses on aligning instructions (text) to a video of someone carrying out a task (vision) using speech recognition. This involves techniques from computer vision (such as deep convolutional neural networks) and natural language processing (such as hidden Markov models). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). However, the paper also involves speech recognition, which falls under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the use of deep learning techniques suggests possible sub-categories of cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper involves machine learning techniques for alignment, which could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning).
